tags: i think the difference is that arya hates being FORCED into it
but if she's not forced she doesn't resent it as much
i don't know if she'll never wear a dress again
i tend to like how visenya is described
she's 'more comfortable in ringmail than in silk.'
Dacey and the female mormont warriors still wore dresses
this turned out realllyyy long i apologize
summary: i just read your arya post and thought i’d send my own pet peeve sorry if i’m being annoying but god i hate when people use...
question: i just read your arya post and thought i’d send my own pet peeve sorry if i’m being annoying but god i hate when people use other things maisie was in as fancasts/aus because it usually means forcing traditional femininity on her idk i just think arya wouldn’t willingly wear a dress and shit it just bothers me
answer:
hmm…well there was a passage in ASOS where Arya actually is forced into a dress when she’s at Acorn Hall. This is after she and Gendry have been roughing it for a while, and after they escaped Harrenhall.

Arya promptly found herself marched upstairs, forced into a tub, and doused with scalding hot water. Lady Smallwood’s maidservants scrubbed her so hard it felt like they were flaying her themselves. They even dumped in some stinky-sweet stuff that smelled like flowers.

And afterward, they insisted she dress herself in girl’s things, brown woolen stockings and a light linen shift, and over that a light green gown with acorns embroidered all over the bodice in brown thread, and more acorns bordering the hem.

And then she and Gendry get into a scuffle (after he expressed amazement at how different she looked in a dress):

Arya was all washed and combed and dressed. Gendry took one look and laughed so hard that wine came out his nose, until Harwin gave him a thwack alongside his ear…  

Both of them were covered in dirt, and one sleeve was torn on her stupid acorn dress. “I bet I don’t look so nice now,” she shouted.

Later, this happens once Lady Smallwood sees the torn dress:

It was even worse than before; Lady Smallwood insisted that Arya take another bath, and cut and comb her hair besides; the dress she put her in this time was sort of lilac-colored, and decorated with little baby pearls. The only good thing about it was that it was so delicate that no one could expect her to ride in it. So the next morning as they broke their fast, Lady Smallwood gave her breeches, belt, and tunic to wear, and a brown doeskin jerkin dotted with iron studs.

This passage, where Arya is being bathed and forced into two dresses, is littered with wording that lets us know she’s unhappy about her circumstances. She’s happy when she’s allowed back into breeches again. Arya definitely values women and their roles in the books (“The woman is important too!” book!Arya protested, unlike show!Arya’s declaration that most girls are stupid). However I do think you’re right about her resenting being forced into traditional femininity. Arya sees what the women around her are expected to do, tries to conform in the beginning, to no avail–and goes her own way. This is not to say that she won’t ever wear a dress happily–she might, we have no idea how she’ll feel about this when she’s older. But I do agree that she would not be happy within the confines of what was expected in the highborn women of her time.

summary: After that post about gen z memelord!arya and concerned millennial!jon, all I can see is arya finishing a drink, looking down at...
body:
After that post about gen z memelord!arya and concerned millennial!jon, all I can see is arya finishing a drink, looking down at her cup, going “This bitch empty” and then standing up and throwing it as hard as she can across the Great Hall while yelling “YEEET” and everyone else just looks at her like she’s lost it except for bran who is just slow clapping

Bonus points if the cup hits tormund on the head and knocks him out

blog.name: aryajon
blog.title: Arya and Jon
blog.description: This fansite is dedicated to Arya Stark and Jon Snow from the show Game of Thrones and the novel series A Song of Ice and Fire. Tracking #aryajon.

summary: Her lord father had taught her never to steal, but it was growing hard to remember why. The silver bracelet she had hoped to...
caption:
Her lord father had taught her never to steal, but it was growing hard to remember why. The silver bracelet she had hoped to sell had been stolen her first night out of the castle, along with her bundle of good clothes, snatched while she slept. All they left her was the cloak she had been huddled in, the leathers on her back, her wooden practice sword and needle.

Often as not, she went to bed hungry.

Often as not, she went to bed hungry.

Often as not, she went to bed hungry.

Often as not, she went to bed hungry.

summary: Can't wait for Arya and Gendry to live happily ever after in a castle of their own building entire cities and Arya being known...
caption:
Can’t wait for Arya and Gendry to live happily ever after in a castle of their own building entire cities and Arya being known as Arya the Builder or something

Mostly I just want them to be happy and live long lives in contentment and good health
